timeline.bodyText: or shall we go with catching Exception as it is done in  normalizePrimitiveValue?

replies.bodyText: maybe I'm missing something: how can a PgArrayParsingException happen here?

replies.bodyText: I think it is better to be more specific when catching the exceptions.

replies.bodyText: ah right, on literal casts, value() is called.

timeline.bodyText: why isn't this type added to the list above (no extra assertion)?
timeline.author: seut

replies.bodyText: it creates an array type for each type from the list above, thus, we cannot add it to the list above.
replies.author: kovrus

timeline.bodyText: shouldn't this be ObjectType.undefined() as well? otherwise it tests the same as here https://github.com/crate/crate/pull/9524/files#diff-726498b21d19949db0e0009971e5b32eR253
timeline.author: seut

replies.bodyText: yes, copy paste error. i drop this test, coz there is already self conversion test that asserts this scenario.
